scenario_text.value:
What was that crazy monster that showed up
inside the fog?

As if things weren’t bad enough. What are we
supposed to do now?
Shuuji...
Wah!

Oh, Takuma! Sorry, I was just talking to
myself.

No, I feel like I should be the one to
apologize. I didn’t mean to scare you.
How are you doing?

Shuuji, you look like you’re in so much pain
all the time. I’m worried about you.
Shut up! What do you know?

As if getting dragged into this strange world
and almost dying several times wasn’t enough!

Is this what we get for carrying on despite
everything? Having to deal with that thing?!
Shuuji...

(Sounds like Shuuji’s scared of that monster
too. Not that I blame him.)

(But as the oldest one here, I feel like he
should at least act like he’s doing okay.)

(He should be relying on Lopmon, but
apparently they’re still on bad terms.)
(What should I say to Shuuji?)
I don’t blame you.
Stay strong.
Lopmon can help.

Hey, I don’t blame you. Honestly, I totally
get why Agumon and the others were so scared.
You mean, you’re scared too, Takuma?
Absolutely.

Oh. You know, I’m kind of relieved to hear
you say that.
What? Why’s that?

Well, when everyone else rushed over to save
Ryo, I was one step behind.

I thought maybe I was the only one who was
scared.
Well, you weren’t.

But I shouldn’t be feeling relieved in the
first place. I need to keep it together.

I’m not sure what there is we can do, but
I’ll try to think more about our next move.

(He does seem like he’s feeling better.
I haven’t seen him like this in a while.)

Shuuji, you need to stay strong. We’re all
counting on you to lead us.

I know that, I do, but...how do we even face
that thing?

Look, we’re all scared. That’s why we need
you to step up and be a leader.
Be...a leader.
Y-you’re right. I need to stay strong.
I’m...the leader. I have to set an example.

(Hmm, he still seems pretty overwhelmed.
Maybe I could’ve worded that better.)

It’s okay, Shuuji. After all, we’ve got our
partners. I have Agumon, and you have Lopmon.

If we all work together, I’m sure we’ll make
it through this somehow!
Yeah! I’ll make sure of it!
I’ll d-do what I can too!

Well, maybe Agumon can help, but I wouldn’t
expect much from Lopmon.
You...wouldn’t?

Of course not! You’re scared of everything!
You’re never any help, especially in a fight.

I can’t believe I’m stuck with you. If I had
a stronger monster, that’s what would help.
Oh... I... I’m sorry, Shuuji.
Hey, don’t you talk to him like that!

We’re better off not even counting on Lopmon
in a fight. He’d only get in the way.

(Shuuji has absolutely no faith in Lopmon.
I feel like that’s a bad thing, but...)

(...how do I get through to him? I can’t just
tell him to trust this strange creature.)

This garbled message must’ve been sent before
we came here.
After all, this is another world, right?
Shuuji...

Anyway, sorry, but would you mind giving me
a little more time on my own?
Uh, are you sure?
Yeah, I could use some time to think.
All right.
Shuuji...
I’m fine. Just leave me alone.
Okay.
(Right now, I think I’d better trust Shuuji.)

Urgh, this is all my fault! If only I’d been
able to keep it together.
Shuuji...
Wah!

Oh, Takuma! Sorry, I was just talking to
myself.

No, I feel like I should be the one to
apologize. I didn’t mean to scare you.
How are you doing?

Shuuji, you look like you’re in so much pain
all the time. I’m worried about you.
Shut up! What do you know?

Not only was I thrown into some strange new
world, I watched someone die in front of me!
I’m sorry... I only meant...

This is exactly the kind of thing the
professor trusted me to keep from happening!

If I’d had my act together, Ryo would still be
here! I’ve completely failed the professor.

Shuuji, I can see why you’d feel that way, but
you shouldn’t blame yourself.

What happened to the two of them wasn’t your
fault.

No, it IS my fault! I’m the oldest, the one
who’s supposed to be the leader!
It was my job to keep everyone safe.

How am I supposed to apologize to Ryo’s
parents?!

(He really feels like he’s responsible for
what happened.)

(But it’s not like he’s solely to blame for
it.)
(None of it was his fault.)
(So how do I answer his question?)
I’ll apologize too.
No need to apologize.
Think of that later.

Well, I’m not sure what you should say, but
I’ll be there to apologize with you.

After all, when it comes to what happened
with Ryo,
I’m at least as responsible as you were.

Thanks. But you shouldn’t have to feel that
way.
I really am a terrible leader, aren’t I?

No, you’re not. You’re doing the best you
can, and I think that’s what counts.
Well, who asked you?

I don’t think you have anything to apologize
for.

After all, nobody could’ve known we’d end up
in a world like this.

What happened to Ryo happened because of that
weird fog and the monster hands inside it.
That’s what I think too.

And what right do you have to an opinion?
You’re one of the monsters!
Lopmon’s just worried about you.
Is he, though? Don’t forget, he’s a monster.
Let’s think of that later.

To be honest, I don’t think focusing on that
is going to help us now.

That’s the kind of thing we can worry about
more after we get back.

But that doesn’t solve anything! It just
delays the problem!

Maybe, but I have a hard enough time thinking
about what to do now.
I think you should listen to Takuma.

Oh, shut up! What do you know about
responsibility?

Anyway, sorry, but would you mind giving me
a little more time on my own?
Uh, are you sure?
Yeah, I could use some time to think.
All right.
Shuuji...
I’m fine. Just leave me alone.
Okay.

(Shuuji’s not taking this well, and his own
strong sense of responsibility isn’t helping.)

(Maybe it’s best if I just leave him alone for
a while.)

Would you mind giving me just a little more
time on my own?
